article:
'Movat's stain' is a stain originally developed by Henry Zoltan Movat
in 1955 to highlight the various constituents of connective tissue, especially
cardiovascular tissue, by five colors in a single stained slide. In
1972, H. K. Russell, Jr. modified the technique so as to reduce the time for
staining and to increase the consistency and reliability of the
staining.
